endemo2.input.input.ProductInput¶

class ProductInput(name, sc, bat, prod, sc_h, sc_h_active, heat_levels, manual_exp_change_rate, perc_used, nuts2_installed_capacity)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Product Input summarizes all input data, that is specific to a certain product type, but holds the information for all countries. Example product type: steel_prim

Parameters:

  • sc – specific_consumption_default

  • bat – bat

  • prod – production

  • sc_h – specific_consumption_historical

  • sc_h_active – Indicates whether specific consumption should be calculated from historical data.

  • heat_levels – heat_levels

  • manual_exp_change_rate – manual_exp_change_rate

  • perc_used – perc_used

Variables:

  • product_name (str) – The name of the product.

  • specific_consumption_default (dict[str, containers.SC]) – Default specific consumption value for this product.

  • specific_consumption_historical (dict[str, (float, float)]) – Historical specific consumption data for this product. Accessible per country.

  • bat (dict[str, containers.EH]) – The best-available-technology consumption for this product. Accessible per country.

  • production (dict[str, (float, float)]) – The historical amount data for this product. Accessible per country.

  • heat_levels (Heat) – How heat demand should be distributed across heat levels for this product.

  • manual_exp_change_rate (float) – If product amount projection will be calculated exponentially, this will be the change rate.

  • perc_used (float) – A scalar for the amount of a product. This is used to model modern technologies replacing old ones.

  • float]] (dict[str, dict[str,) – Installed capacity in %/100 for each NUTS2 Region. Structure {country_name -> {nuts2_region_name -> capacity_value}}

Methods

__init__

__str__()[source]¶

Return str(self).
